results.title: Maria going home
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Debby Kingsland and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Maria, originally from Spain, has been in Australia some fifteen years - half her life. In the film she and her family discuss plans to return to Spain. The film is intended to show why a family, materially and professionally successful in Australia and with two Australian born children might choose to uproot themselves a second time.

results.title: Tempted
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett, Larry Katz, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, TFI International and Golden Circle Films
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Bennett, Larry Katz, David Kronemyer, Jennifer Cluff, TFI International and Golden Circle Films

Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. results.title: Breathe
results.creator_credit: Yan Wawrzynczak, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Yan Wawrzynczak weaves a moving story about a man, the woman he fell in love with and their child. Over several continents and many years, Wawrzynczak covers the changing seasons of this relationship as the three move in and out of each other’s lives.

results.title: Temples of time
results.creator_credit: William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A mountain is a living thing; it has an ecological balance, a process of evolution manifested in slow, subtle ways; but it is also subject to the ravages of human intervention. Filmed in the Canadian Rockies and in Garibaldi Park, this picture brings to the screen magnificent footage of mountain solitudes and the wildlife found there, of natural splendor in all its changing moods. The film carries the implicit warning that all this may pass away if people do not seek to preserve it.

results.title: Ethnic broadcasting
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Shows how a group of Greek women and men started their own radio program motivated by pride and interest in their own ethnic origins and an awareness of the cultural deprivation of Greek migrants in Adelaide.

results.title: Temperate rain forest
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of a group of short films on various climatic, geographic and ecological zones in British Columbia, The Temperate Rain Forest examines the special characteristics, including the life cycle and food chain, of the northwest coastal rain forest. Its highly acidic soil results in a specialized plant community and an abundance of amphibians and reptiles. As the camera reveals, it is a place of exquisite beauty, and one that has an important place in the ecology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Ana: an interpreter
results.creator_credit: Debby Kingsland, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Ana is a Spanish/English interpreter in a Sydney family centre. The film shows some of the problems with which she works - human rather than linguistic ones - and her relationships with English-speaking co-workers. The film is designed to raise questions about the need for communicators like Ana and about the isolation of non-English speaking people.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of a family who have moved from a small country town to Sydney for the benefit of their children. Discusses some of the problems and differences they encounter. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Meg Stewart, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
